titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the David Benjamin Bolen Papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by David Jacobs

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-02-11T10:51-0800

did.abstract: Speeches and writings, correspondence, dispatches, memoranda, reports, clippings, and photographs, relating to American relations with South Africa, Botswana, Lesotho, Swaziland and East Germany.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], David Benjamin Bolen papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Increments may have been received since this finding aid was prepared. Please check Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/ to find the full extent of the collection.

chronitem.event: Member of United States Olympic Team, participates in London games
Vice Consul, U.S. Embassy, Monrovia, Liberia
Economic Assistant, U.S. Embassy, Karachi, Pakistan
International Economist, U.S. State Department, Washington, D.C.
Afghanistan Desk Officer, U.S. State Department, Washington, D.C.
Chief of Economic Section, U.S. Embassy, Accra, Ghana
Staff Assistant, Secretary of State for African Affairs, Washington, D.C.
Officer-in-Charge, Nigerian Affairs, U.S. State Department, Washington, D.C.
Economic Counselor, U.S. Embassy, Bonn, West Germany
Economic/Commercial Counselor, U.S. Embassy, Belgrade, Yugoslavia
U.S. Ambassador to Botswana, Lesotho, and Swaziland
Deputy Assistant Secretary of State for Africa, Washington, D.C.
U.S. Ambassador to the German Democratic Republic, East Berlin
Associate Director, International Affairs, E.I. du Pont de Nemours and Co.
Distinguished Business Service Award, University of Colorado, Boulder

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Acquired in 2003, the David B. Bolen collection in the Hoover Institution Archives documents the long and distinguished career of an American diplomat whose service included ambassadorships in southern Africa and East Germany. The collection consists primarily of official correspondence and reports relating to these and other postings in Bolen's diplomatic career; it also includes materials pertaining to his subsequent work for the E.I. du Pont de Nemours and Co.

The collection has significant materials relating to bilateral diplomacy between the United States and the German Democratic Republic, and to East-West relations in general during the Carter administration, including tensions arising from the Soviet invasion of Afghanistan in 1979. There are reports and official correspondence concerning Bolen's conduct of negotiations leading to a consular agreement between the U.S. and GDR, and numerous documents regarding disputes and incidents stemming from the divided status of Berlin during the latter part of the Cold War. The collection also has extensive materials pertaining to internal developments within the GDR, including the East German government's treatment of dissident artists and writers.

Expanding American exports to East Germany was a high priority of Bolen's ambassadorship, and economic issues figure prominently in the collection as a whole. In particular, there are accounts of American participation in trade fairs in Leipzig. There are also photographs and other materials relating to Bolen's meetings with East German leaders on such occasions, including the head of state, Erich Honecker.

The Bolen collection is equally rich in documentation on political and economic affairs in southern Africa during the 1970s and 1980s. The collection includes correspondence and reports from Bolen's tenure as United States Ambassador to Botswana, Lesotho, and Swaziland, and extensive materials relating to South Africa from Bolen's career with E.I. du Pont de Nemours and Co. The collection has extensive correspondence and reports on the implementation of the Sullivan principles by foreign companies doing business in South Africa, and on opposition inside that country, and internationally, to the apartheid system.

The collection also contains a selection of speeches and remarks made by Ambassador Bolen over the course of his diplomatic and business careers, most of which deal with African and East German issues. There are also biographical materials, including accounts of Bolen's early prominence as an Olympic athlete. Throughout the collection are interspersed documents that record Bolen's own thoughts on American foreign policy, as well as his views on civil rights and his experiences as a prominent African-American official in the diplomatic service of the United States.
As far as possible, the original arrangement of the collection, as established by Ambassador Bolen, has been preserved.

item.extref: Downloadable PDF file of the Microfilm Reel Content Guide

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Clippings, correspondence, photographs, programs, reports, and speeches, relating to Bolen's academic, diplomatic, and business careers, as arranged by Bolen

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's athletic career, including his participation in track and field events in Greece, Czechoslovakia, and Poland; and clippings and correspondence pertaining to the question of racial discrimination in American universities and in Boulder, Colorado, during the 1940s

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's appearances in the 1948 Olympic Games in London, and in other track and field competitions

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's participation in various track and field competitions

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's participation in international track and field competitions, and to his studies at the University of Colorado. Includes some materials pertaining to his wife, Betty Gayden Bolen, and a copy of a certificate of David B. Bolen's appointment as Vice Consul of the United States in Monrovia, Liberia

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's diplomatic career in the U.S. State Department, including service as an international relations officer attached to the American embassy in Karachi, Pakistan, and as Afghanistan desk officer in the U.S. State Department, Washington, D.C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's graduate studies in public administration at Harvard University and to his diplomatic career, including service as the economic officer attached to the American embassy in Accra, Ghana. Includes typescript of a speech by Bolen on economic development, Accra, Ghana, 1961 May, and photographs of John F. Kennedy, 1963, and Shirley Temple Black, n.d.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's assignment to duties in the U.S. State Department, Washington, D.C. Includes papers and speeches by Bolen on economic development and minority rights issues, and correspondence regarding the coup d'état in Ghana, 1966

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's activities accompanying Assistant Secretary of State, Gov. Mennen Williams, on a diplomatic mission to Africa, 1965. Includes clippings relating to the Vietnam War and American foreign policy

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's service as economic officer attached to the American embassy in Bonn, West Germany. Includes clippings and correspondence pertaining to the George Norlin Award, given to Bolen in 1969 by the Associated Alumni of the University of Colorado

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's activities as economic officer in Bonn, West Germany. Includes one address, "U.S. Interests and Objectives in Western Europe," and several shorter speeches, all delivered by Bolen

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's service as economic officer attached to the American embassy in Belgrade, Yugoslavia. Includes some interpolated personal correspondence, 1990

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's professional activities in Yugoslavia, and concerning his appointment as U.S. Ambassador to Botswana, Lesotho, and Swaziland. Includes correspondence and reports pertaining to a visit to Yugoslavia by George Shultz, Secretary of the Treasury, 1973

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's tenure as Ambassador to Botswana, Lesotho, and Swaziland

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence regarding Bolen's appointment as ambassador, largely from other members of the foreign service of the United States

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence regarding Bolen's appointment as ambassador, largely from other members of the foreign service of the United States

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's duties as Ambassador to Botswana, Lesotho, and Swaziland. Includes clippings and correspondence pertaining to the visit of Rev. Andrew Sullivan to Botswana in 1975, and some interpolated materials pertaining to the application of the Sullivan principles to foreign business activities in South Africa, 1984-1990

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's duties as Ambassador to Botswana, Lesotho, and Swaziland

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes interpolated clipping, 1979, relating to a 1976 murder case involving William Bradford Bishop, an American diplomat posted to Botswana in the early 1970s

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's duties as Ambassador to Botswana, Lesotho, and Swaziland

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes clippings and correspondence relating to the awarding of an honorary degree to Ambassador Bolen from Princeton University

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes clippings and correspondence relating to the Soweto riots in South Africa

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's appointment as Deputy Assistant Secretary of State, Bureau of African Affairs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's duties as Deputy Assistant Secretary of State

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes a speech by Bolen on relations between the United States and Botswana, Lesotho, and Swaziland, n.d.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence and photographs relating to a visit to Gaborone, Botswana by Sen. Charles M. Percy, and a visit to Africa by Secretary of State Henry Kissinger, with whom Bolen traveled as member of delegation

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's duties as Ambassador to Botswana, Lesotho, and Swaziland

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes materials relating to political developments in the Kingdom of Lesotho

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes printed copy of a speech by Ambassador Bolen, Maseru, Lesotho, 1974 October 7

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's duties as Ambassador to Botswana, Lesotho, and Swaziland

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes typescript of a speech on the media delivered by Ambassador Bolen, Maseru, Lesotho, 1975 June 23

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes official correspondence relating to the American position vis-à-vis the civil war in Angola

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's duties as Ambassador to Botswana, Lesotho, and Swaziland

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes typescript of a speech delivered by Ambassador Bolen, Swaziland, 1974 May 17

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's appointment as Ambassador to Botswana, Lesotho, and Swaziland

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's duties as Ambassador to Botswana, Lesotho, and Swaziland

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's appointment as U.S. Ambassador to the German Democratic Republic

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's duties as Ambassador to the German Democratic Republic, including official correspondence providing Bolen's analyses of political developments in the GDR

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's appointment as Ambassador to the German Democratic Republic, including letters of congratulations

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's duties as Ambassador to the German Democratic Republic, including official correspondence pertaining to his meetings with Erich Honecker and other GDR officials

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's duties as Ambassador to the German Democratic Republic

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes typescript of a speech delivered by Bolen, "US-GDR Relations in a Rapidly Changing World," University of Kentucky, 1978 February 16

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence and memoranda relating to a visit to East Berlin by Assistant Secretary of State Patricia M. Derian, 1978 October

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's duties as Ambassador to the German Democratic Republic, including official correspondence summarizing his meetings with GDR officials

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's duties as Ambassador to the German Democratic Republic, including official correspondence summarizing his meetings with GDR officials

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's duties as Ambassador to the German Democratic Republic, with some interpolated correspondence pertaining to his work for the Du Pont corporation, 1982, and minutes of a meeting of trustees, University of Delaware, 1991

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's duties as Ambassador to the German Democratic Republic, especially concerning negotiations with the East Germans conducted by Deputy Assistant Secretary of State James E. Goodby, Washington, D.C., 1979 May 3-4

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's duties as Ambassador to the German Democratic Republic

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes clippings and photographs pertaining to a visit to the Leipzig Trade Fair by Erich Honecker

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes advance copy of a speech delivered by Leonid Brezhnev, East Berlin, 1979 October 6. In Russian, with English translation. Also includes printed copy of a consular convention signed between the United States and East Germany, and typescript of remarks made by Ambassador Bolen at the signing ceremony for this convention, 1979 September 4

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's duties as Ambassador to the German Democratic Republic

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes typescript of remarks delivered by Bolen concerning negotiation of a consular convention with the GDR, 1979 May 22

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes some interpolated correspondence from the University of Kentucky, 1977 October 1

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's duties as Ambassador to the German Democratic Republic

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence and photographs relating to a hunting party hosted by Erich Honecker, 1978 December

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes clippings and correspondence relating to the Leipzig Trade Fair, 1979 March

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's duties as Ambassador to the German Democratic Republic

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes some correspondence addressed to Betty Bolen

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's duties as Ambassador to the German Democratic Republic, including official correspondence detailing meetings with East German officials

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence and memoranda relating to American reaction to the Soviet intervention in Afghanistan and its effect on East-West relations

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence relating to Bolen's views on the American boycott of the 1980 Moscow Olympics

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to the completion of Bolen's tenure as Ambassador to the German Democratic Republic

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence pertaining to the American boycott of the 1980 Moscow Olympics

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes clippings relating to Bolen's farewell meetings with Erich Honecker and other officials of the GDR and the diplomatic corps in East Germany

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Official correspondence and reports relating to the Conference on Security and Cooperation in Europe, and to human rights issues raised by Bolen with the government of the GDR

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's appointment as Ambassador to the German Democratic Republic

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to consultations in Washington, D.C., 1980 January 28 - February 1, conducted as part of Bolen's service as Ambassador to the German Democratic Republic

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes clippings and photographs pertaining to Bolen's presentation of his credentials to Erich Honecker, Chairman of the Council of State of the GDR, East Berlin, 1977 August 22

scopecontent.p: Includes printed transcript of a town hall meeting conducted by President Jimmy Carter, West Berlin, 1978 July 15

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's duties as Ambassador to the German Democratic Republic, including a discussion paper outlining the American position in advance of a NATO meeting held on 1978 October 2-5, and a cable prepared by Bolen summarizing relations between the U.S. and the GDR, 1980 March 31

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's duties as Ambassador to the German Democratic Republic, primarily to negotiations between the U.S. and the GDR regarding a consular convention

scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's duties as Ambassador to the German Democratic Republic, primarily to the signing of a consular convention negotiated between the U.S. and the GDR

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's duties as Ambassador to the German Democratic Republic

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes cable containing a detailed analysis of cultural developments in East Germany, including the activities of dissident writers, 1977 July 15

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's duties as Ambassador to the German Democratic Republic. Includes official correspondence relating to the "Splendors of Dresden" touring exhibition of art on loan from the GDR, and a printed copy of a speech by President Carter inaugurating this show's opening in Washington, D.C., 1978 June 1

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's duties as Ambassador to the German Democratic Republic. Includes official correspondence relating to cultural exchanges between the United States and East Germany, including tours of the GDR by American musicians, and a traveling exhibit of photographs from the US

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's duties as Ambassador to the German Democratic Republic. Includes official correspondence relating to dissent in the GDR, and the case of the East German writer, Stefan Heym

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's duties as Ambassador to the German Democratic Republic, with an emphasis on cultural and educational exchanges between the United States and the GDR

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's duties as Ambassador to the German Democratic Republic, especially regarding the resolution of humanitarian cases pending between the United States and the GDR. Includes official correspondence pertaining to divided families and Americans detained in the GDR

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's duties as Ambassador to the German Democratic Republic, including official correspondence relating to the granting of travel visas by the GDR authorities

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's duties as Ambassador to the German Democratic Republic. Includes official correspondence pertaining to the settlement of Jewish material claims made against East Germany in compensation for property losses suffered under the Nazis

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes an interpolated letter from Angelika Timm, 1995 March 8

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's duties as Ambassador to the German Democratic Republic, with an emphasis on the resolution of humanitarian cases pending between the United States and the GDR. Includes official correspondence pertaining to divided families and American citizens detained in the GDR

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's duties as Ambassador to the German Democratic Republic, especially with regard to commercial relations between the United States and the GDR

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's duties as Ambassador to the German Democratic Republic, with an emphasis on negotiations conducted with the GDR over the issues of the repatriation of cultural property and Jewish material claims made against the GDR for losses suffered under the Nazis

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's duties as Ambassador to the German Democratic Republic. Includes official correspondence pertaining to the defection to West Germany in 1979 of an East German driver working for the American embassy in East Berlin

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's duties as Ambassador to the German Democratic Republic. Includes official correspondence pertaining to East German coverage of neo-Nazi activities in West Germany, and to American reaction to East German positions taken during the World Conference to Combat Racism and Racial Discrimination, Geneva, 1978. Also contains correspondence relating to the American investigation of war crimes committed during the Nazi era, and to the request by the United States of judicial assistance from the GDR in this matter

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's duties as Ambassador to the German Democratic Republic, consisting largely of official correspondence pertaining to the hijacking of a Polish airliner by an East German citizen, 1978 August 30, and his subsequent trial by American authorities in West Berlin

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's duties as Ambassador to the German Democratic Republic, consisting largely of official correspondence pertaining to the Iranian hostage crisis and its repercussions in terms of East-West relations

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's duties as Ambassador to the German Democratic Republic, consisting largely of official correspondence pertaining to the Iranian hostage crisis and its repercussions in terms of East-West relations

scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's duties as Ambassador to the German Democratic Republic, consisting largely of official correspondence pertaining to the Soviet invasion of Afghanistan and its effects on US-GDR relations

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's duties as Ambassador to the German Democratic Republic, consisting largely of official correspondence pertaining to the 18th anniversary of the erection of the Berlin Wall and other issues related to the divided status of Berlin

scopecontent.p: Including clippings and correspondence regarding the flight of East German citizens to West Germany

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's duties as Ambassador to the German Democratic Republic, consisting primarily of official correspondence pertaining to cultural exchanges between the United States and the GDR, and to the signing of a consular convention between these two countries. Includes typescript of remarks given by Bolen concerning the sending to Germany of a sculpture about the dismantling of the Berlin Wall, Denver, Colorado, 1998 June 6

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to Bolen's induction into the University of Colorado's Hall of Fame, 2000 August 10, and to his being recognized as a distinguished alumnus during the 125th anniversary celebration of the University of Colorado, 2001 April 20.
